Atlanta-class light cruiser (Atlanta-class light cruiser) is a class of light cruisers of the United States Navy. A total of 11 ships were built, including 8 ships as flagship cruisers of the destroyer squadron to replace the Omaha-class cruisers in the pre-war plan, and 3 additional ships to compensate for wartime losses. Generally known as an air defense cruiser, the classification symbol CLAA representing an air defense cruiser was given after commissioning.
